context_sentences.en: Oh, wait a moment!
context_sentences.ja: あ、ちょっとまって！

context_sentences.en: I think it's a little different.
context_sentences.ja: ちょっとちがう気がする。

context_sentences.en: I'll think about it a little.
context_sentences.ja: ちょっと考えてみるよ。

context_sentences.en: Good morning, Miho-chan!
context_sentences.ja: ミホちゃん、おはよう！

context_sentences.en: I texted "good morning" to Mike.
context_sentences.ja: マイクに「おはよう」とメールをした。

context_sentences.en: Ugh, I'm sleepy... morning.
context_sentences.ja: うーっ、ねむいー、おはよう。

context_sentences.en: Did you book a hotel already?
context_sentences.ja: ホテル、もうとった？

context_sentences.en: I'm just about to check out of the hotel.
context_sentences.ja: 今、ホテルをチェックアウトするところ。

context_sentences.en: Which hotel will you stay at?
context_sentences.ja: どこのホテルにステイするの？

context_sentences.en: This one is Mt Fuji.
context_sentences.ja: これがふじ山です。

context_sentences.en: This is a pen.
context_sentences.ja: これはペンです。

context_sentences.en: Give me two of these, please.
context_sentences.ja: これを二つ下さい。

context_sentences.en: What do you want to do for Christmas?
context_sentences.ja: クリスマス、どうする？

context_sentences.en: If you don't, someone else will.
context_sentences.ja: あなたがしなくても、だれかがするよ。

context_sentences.en: Shoot there with all your might.
context_sentences.ja: そこで、力いっぱいシュートをするんだ。

context_sentences.en: Two apple juices, please.
context_sentences.ja: リンゴジュース、二つ下さい。

context_sentences.en: Do you want an apple or a banana?
context_sentences.ja: リンゴかバナナ、いる？

context_sentences.en: This apple tastes bad!
context_sentences.ja: このリンゴ、まずい！

context_sentences.en: Do you want a cup of coffee?
context_sentences.ja: コーヒー、のむ？

context_sentences.en: Should we have a coffee break soon?
context_sentences.ja: そろそろコーヒーブレークにする？

context_sentences.en: One hot coffee, please.
context_sentences.ja: ホットコーヒー、一つ下さい。

context_sentences.en: Hello Sensei.
context_sentences.ja: 先生、こんにちは。

context_sentences.en: Hello Aya.
context_sentences.ja: アヤちゃん、こんにちは。

context_sentences.en: Hello, I'm Jenny.
context_sentences.ja: こんにちは、ジェニーです。

context_sentences.en: When will you do it?
context_sentences.ja: いつするの？

context_sentences.en: When are you in the U.S. until?
context_sentences.ja: いつまでアメリカ？

context_sentences.en: When will you be in Canada from?
context_sentences.ja: いつからカナダ？

context_sentences.en: Which one of these ties shall I give as a gift?
context_sentences.ja: プレゼントのネクタイ、どれにする？

context_sentences.en: Can you tell which ones are tasty onions?
context_sentences.ja: どれがおいしい玉ねぎか、分かる？

context_sentences.en: Hmm, which one should I cut first?
context_sentences.ja: えっと、どれから切ればいい？

context_sentences.en: I'm going to speak on TV now.
context_sentences.ja: 今から、テレビでしゃべるんだ。

context_sentences.en: What, you're going on TV?
context_sentences.ja: えっ、テレビに出るの？

context_sentences.en: I'll turn on the TV immediately!
context_sentences.ja: すぐにテレビをつけるよ！

context_sentences.en: Yep, let's do that!
context_sentences.ja: うん、そうしよう！

context_sentences.en: Yeah, sorry, that's wrong.
context_sentences.ja: うん、ごめん、ちがう。

context_sentences.en: Yep, it's yummy!
context_sentences.ja: うん、おいしい！

context_sentences.en: "Mr. Chandler." "Yes!"
context_sentences.ja: 「チャンドラーさん」「はい！」

context_sentences.en: Yes, thank you very much.
context_sentences.ja: はい、ありがとうございます。

context_sentences.en: Yes, understood.
context_sentences.ja: はい、分かりました。

context_sentences.en: If it's that notebook you mean, it's on my desk.
context_sentences.ja: そのノートなら、デスクの上だよ。

context_sentences.en: Did you take good notes on the lesson?
context_sentences.ja: レッスン、ちゃんとノートにまとめた？

context_sentences.en: I need an A4 size notebook, you know.
context_sentences.ja: A4サイズのノートがいるんだよね。

context_sentences.en: Goodbye Sensei.
context_sentences.ja: 先生、さようなら。

context_sentences.en: Goodbye January. Hello February.
context_sentences.ja: さようなら、一月。こんにちは、二月。

context_sentences.en: So long, and thanks for all the fish.
context_sentences.ja: さようなら、今までサカナをありがとう。

context_sentences.en: Oh, good evening.
context_sentences.ja: あ、こんばんは。

context_sentences.en: Good evening, everyone.
context_sentences.ja: みなさん、こんばんは。

context_sentences.en: Good evening. Nice work today!
context_sentences.ja: こんばんは〜、おつかれさまです！

context_sentences.en: That looks fun!
context_sentences.ja: それ、おもしろそうだね！

context_sentences.en: Oh, you're going to go for that?
context_sentences.ja: え、それにするの？

context_sentences.en: That's not candy, that's an eyeball.
context_sentences.ja: それはキャンディじゃなくて目玉です。

context_sentences.en: Oh, you work part-time at a convenience store?
context_sentences.ja: え、コンビニでバイトしてるの？

context_sentences.en: Convenience store rice balls are so good!
context_sentences.ja: コンビニのおにぎりっておいしいよね！

context_sentences.en: Oh, there's a convenience store over there!
context_sentences.ja: あ、あそこにコンビニがある！

context_sentences.en: I'm in the department store restroom right now.
context_sentences.ja: 今、デパートのトイレにいる。

context_sentences.en: They had that at the department store.
context_sentences.ja: それ、デパートにあったよ。

context_sentences.en: I saw Leo at the department store!
context_sentences.ja: レオなら、デパートで見かけたよ！

context_sentences.en: Oh, excuse me! I'm sorry!
context_sentences.ja: あ、すみません！ごめんなさい！

context_sentences.en: Excuse me, where's the "Ocean Hotel"?
context_sentences.ja: すみません、オーシャンホテルってどこですか。

context_sentences.en: Excuse me, is now a good time?
context_sentences.ja: すみません、今ちょっといいですか？

context_sentences.en: No, it's not.
context_sentences.ja: いいえ、ちがいます。

context_sentences.en: No, you have the wrong person.
context_sentences.ja: いいえ、人ちがいです。

context_sentences.en: No, it's not England. It's Canada.
context_sentences.ja: いいえ、イギリスじゃないです。カナダです。

context_sentences.en: Is this your blog?
context_sentences.ja: これ、あなたのブログですか？

context_sentences.en: What would you do in that kind of situation?
context_sentences.ja: こんなとき、あなたならどうしますか？

context_sentences.en: I miss you darling.
context_sentences.ja: あなたがいなくてさみしです。

context_sentences.en: Who's this?
context_sentences.ja: この人、だれ？

context_sentences.en: Please look at this page.
context_sentences.ja: このページを見てください。

context_sentences.en: Sorry, my schedule is full on this day.
context_sentences.ja: ごめん、この日はスケジュールがいっぱいなんだ。

context_sentences.en: Isn't that Emily over there?
context_sentences.ja: あれ、エミリーじゃない？

context_sentences.en: That one over there is my house.
context_sentences.ja: あれがオレのうちだよ。

context_sentences.en: That was terrible, to say the least.
context_sentences.ja: いくらなんでもあれはヒドいよ。

context_sentences.en: It says this bread costs $5.
context_sentences.ja: このパン、５ドルだって。

context_sentences.en: Is that U.S. dollars? Or is it Canadian dollars?
context_sentences.ja: それって米ドル？それともカナダドル？

context_sentences.en: The dollar to yen rate finally reached 150 yen to the dollar.
context_sentences.ja: ついにドル円のレートが１ドル＝１５０円になった。

context_sentences.en: Which child is Maria?
context_sentences.ja: どの子がマリアちゃん？

context_sentences.en: I wonder which hotel I should stay at.
context_sentences.ja: どのホテルにしようかな。

context_sentences.en: When can you do it?
context_sentences.ja: どのタイミングでできますか？

context_sentences.en: I don't have any money at all.
context_sentences.ja: お金がぜんぜんない。

context_sentences.en: Do you have scissors?
context_sentences.ja: ハサミ、ない？

context_sentences.en: I don't have scissors, but I do have a cutter.
context_sentences.ja: ハサミはないけど、カッターならあるよ。

context_sentences.en: Oh, I don't have my bag!
context_sentences.ja: あ、カバンがない！

context_sentences.en: That's funny. I thought I put them in my bag.
context_sentences.ja: おかしいなぁ。カバンに入れたはずなのに。

context_sentences.en: I opted for a larger bag that can hold a lot of stuff.
context_sentences.ja: いっぱい入るよう、大きめのカバンにしたよ。

context_sentences.en: I can't find a cab at all.
context_sentences.ja: タクシーがぜんぜん見つからないんだよね。

context_sentences.en: Shall we take a cab?
context_sentences.ja: タクシーで行く？

context_sentences.en: Don't use me as a taxi!
context_sentences.ja: タクシー代わりにしないでよ！

context_sentences.en: That person is famous.
context_sentences.ja: その人、有名人だよ。

context_sentences.en: I'm busy that day.
context_sentences.ja: その日は、いそがしいんだ。

context_sentences.en: At that moment, there was a loud boom.
context_sentences.ja: そのとき、ドーンと大きな音がした。

context_sentences.en: I think I've seen that person over there somewhere before.
context_sentences.ja: あの人、どこかで見たことある気がする。

context_sentences.en: Do you remember that day?
context_sentences.ja: あの日のこと、おぼえてる？

context_sentences.en: I should have said "thank you" at the time.
context_sentences.ja: あのとき、「ありがとう」って言えばよかった。

context_sentences.en: But I can't.
context_sentences.ja: でも、できないよ。

context_sentences.en: But are you okay with that?
context_sentences.ja: でも、いいの？

context_sentences.en: But it's 50 percent off, you know?
context_sentences.ja: でも、５０パーセントオフだよ？

context_sentences.en: I don't know that yet.
context_sentences.ja: それはまだ分からないよ。

context_sentences.en: What, are you still in the bathroom?
context_sentences.ja: え、まだトイレにいるの？

context_sentences.en: If you're looking for Ken, he's still taking a shower.
context_sentences.ja: ケンなら、まだシャワーしてるよ。

context_sentences.en: Let's eat here!
context_sentences.ja: ここで食べよう！

context_sentences.en: If you're looking for your glasses, they're here.
context_sentences.ja: メガネなら、ここにあるよ。

context_sentences.en: Where am I? Who am I?
context_sentences.ja: ここはどこ？私はだれ？

context_sentences.en: Today I ate a muffin as a snack.
context_sentences.ja: 今日はおやつにマフィンを食べた。

context_sentences.en: Shall we take a snack break?
context_sentences.ja: そろそろおやつにする？

context_sentences.en: Kaori's snacks are always homemade!
context_sentences.ja: カオリちゃんのおやつは、いつも手作りだよ！

context_sentences.en: Where are you going?
context_sentences.ja: どこに行くの？

context_sentences.en: Which McDonald's?
context_sentences.ja: どこのマクドナルド？

context_sentences.en: Where do you come from?
context_sentences.ja: どこから来たの？

context_sentences.en: Hello, this is Yamakawa.
context_sentences.ja: もしもし、山川です。

context_sentences.en: Hello, can you hear me?
context_sentences.ja: もしもし、きこえますか？

context_sentences.en: Hello, what are you doing now?
context_sentences.ja: もしもし、今なにしてるの？

context_sentences.en: I've played almost all of the games here.
context_sentences.ja: ここにあるゲーム、ほとんどプレイしたことあるよ。

context_sentences.en: I hardly understand any of this lecture.
context_sentences.ja: このレクチャー、ほとんど分からないんだけど。

context_sentences.en: Most people have smartphones nowadays.
context_sentences.ja: 今どき、スマホなんてほとんどの人がもってるでしょ。

context_sentences.en: Is this pen made of glass?
context_sentences.ja: このペン、ガラスで出来てるの？

context_sentences.en: Wow, it looks like Cinderella's glass slipper.
context_sentences.ja: うわー、シンデレラのガラスのくつみたい。

context_sentences.en: You have bird poop on your windshield.
context_sentences.ja: フロントガラスに鳥のフンが付いてるよ。

context_sentences.en: I met my teacher there.
context_sentences.ja: そこで先生に会ったよ。

context_sentences.en: If you're looking for snacks, they're there.
context_sentences.ja: おやつなら、そこにあるよ。

context_sentences.en: You don't have to say so much!
context_sentences.ja: そこまで言わなくてもいいじゃない！

context_sentences.en: My house is over there.
context_sentences.ja: 私のうちは、あそこだよ。

context_sentences.en: Let's take a short rest over there!
context_sentences.ja: あそこでちょっと休もう！

context_sentences.en: What's that thing over there?
context_sentences.ja: あそこにあるのは何？

context_sentences.en: I lost five kilos in one month.
context_sentences.ja: 一ヶ月で五キロやせました。

context_sentences.en: It is roughly 3 km from our house to the school.
context_sentences.ja: うちから学校まで、大体３キロです。

context_sentences.en: This stone sells for only one yen per kilo.
context_sentences.ja: この石は、キロ当たり１円にしかなりません。

context_sentences.en: Oh, I can smell cigarette smoke.
context_sentences.ja: あ、タバコのにおいがする。

context_sentences.en: I've been struggling to quit smoking.
context_sentences.ja: タバコが中々やめられないんだ。

context_sentences.en: It's not good to smoke while walking.
context_sentences.ja: 歩きタバコはよくないよ。

context_sentences.en: The service at that restaurant isn't great, is it?
context_sentences.ja: あのレストランのサービス、ビミョーじゃない？

context_sentences.en: It's on the house.
context_sentences.ja: サービスです。

context_sentences.en: Eh, it's just lip service, isn't it?
context_sentences.ja: えー、ただのリップサービスじゃない？

context_sentences.en: When I bought cream buns, they gave me bread crusts for free.
context_sentences.ja: クリームパン買ったら、パンの耳、サービスしてくれた。

context_sentences.en: However, that was a lie.
context_sentences.ja: しかし、それはウソだった。

context_sentences.en: However, it was raining that day.
context_sentences.ja: しかし、その日は雨だった。

context_sentences.en: However, she was found by the queen.
context_sentences.ja: しかし、女王に見つかってしまった。

context_sentences.en: I always eat bread in the mornings.
context_sentences.ja: 朝はいつもパンを食べます。

context_sentences.en: Oh, we're out of bread.
context_sentences.ja: あ、食パン切れてる。

context_sentences.en: It says bread crusts are 100 yen.
context_sentences.ja: パンの耳、百円だって。

context_sentences.en: Thank you, I am very happy to hear that.
context_sentences.ja: ありがとう、とてもうれしいです。

context_sentences.en: This is a very precious teddy bear.
context_sentences.ja: これは、とても大切なテディベアなの。

context_sentences.en: That teacher's lecture is very easy to understand.
context_sentences.ja: あの先生のレクチャーはとても分かりやすい。

context_sentences.en: My company is in that office building over there.
context_sentences.ja: うちの会社は、あそこのオフィスビルに入ってるんだよ。

context_sentences.en: I'll call you when I get out of the building.
context_sentences.ja: ビルから出たら、電話するよ。

context_sentences.en: The moon was visible in a gap between the tall buildings.
context_sentences.ja: ビルの谷間に月が見えた。

context_sentences.en: I've already seen that anime.
context_sentences.ja: そのアニメ、もう見たよ。

context_sentences.en: I'm almost done!
context_sentences.ja: もうそろそろ終わる！

context_sentences.en: I understand. I won't come here anymore.
context_sentences.ja: 分かった。ここにはもう来ないね。

context_sentences.en: That dress is so cute!
context_sentences.ja: そのワンピース、めっちゃかわいいね！

context_sentences.en: I bought five dresses at a bargain sale.
context_sentences.ja: バーゲンで、ワンピースを五着も買っちゃった。

context_sentences.en: I spilled coffee on my favorite white dress.
context_sentences.ja: お気に入りの白いワンピースにコーヒーをこぼしてしまった。

context_sentences.en: We can see the fireworks really well from the balcony of my apartment!
context_sentences.ja: うちのマンションのベランダから、花火めっちゃよく見えるよ！

context_sentences.en: Huh, you'd rather live in an apartment than in your own house? Why?
context_sentences.ja: えーっ、マイホームよりマンションに住む方がいいの？なんで？

context_sentences.en: I'm planning to leave this apartment next month.
context_sentences.ja: 私、来月、このマンションを出る予定なんだ。

context_sentences.en: This is an onomatopoeia that expresses a sense of softness.
context_sentences.ja: これは、やわらかいイメージを表すオノマトペですね。

context_sentences.en: What is your favorite onomatopoeia and why do you like it?
context_sentences.ja: 好きなオノマトペと、それが好きな理由を教えてください。

context_sentences.en: How do you all learn Japanese onomatopoeias?
context_sentences.ja: 日本語のオノマトペって、みんなどうやって勉強してるの？

context_sentences.en: We're going to play poker, so can you go buy some playing cards?
context_sentences.ja: ポーカーするからトランプ買ってきて！

context_sentences.en: Hey, want to play cards?
context_sentences.ja: ねえ、トランプしない？

context_sentences.en: I'm not very good at shuffling cards.
context_sentences.ja: トランプ切るの、苦手なんだよね。

context_sentences.en: Wow, this bread is so fluffy, isn't it!
context_sentences.ja: うわー、このパン、ふわふわだね！

context_sentences.en: Isn't it cute to see jellyfish floating in the sea?
context_sentences.ja: クラゲが海でふわふわ泳いでるのって、かわいくない？

context_sentences.en: I’m kind of light-headed.
context_sentences.ja: なんか頭がふわふわする。

context_sentences.en: How did you become fluent in Japanese?
context_sentences.ja: どうやって日本語ペラペラになったの？

context_sentences.en: Ah, I want to be able to speak English fluently soon.
context_sentences.ja: あー、はやく英語がペラペラ話せるようになりたい。

context_sentences.en: Hey, you've been blabbing on and on! We're in the library, remember?
context_sentences.ja: ねえ、さっきから、ペラペラペラペラうるさいよ！ここ、図書館だよ？

context_sentences.en: Oh man, I'm so nervous.
context_sentences.ja: やばい、めっちゃドキドキする。

context_sentences.en: He was so cool that my heart was pounding.
context_sentences.ja: カッコよくて、ドキドキでした。

context_sentences.en: I could feel your excitement.
context_sentences.ja: ドキドキが伝わってきたよ。

context_sentences.en: Apparently, an overnight stay with a breakfast buffet costs 5,000 yen at this hotel.
context_sentences.ja: このホテル、朝食バイキング付きで五千円だって。

context_sentences.en: Would you like to go to an all-you-can-eat cake place with me sometime?
context_sentences.ja: 今度いっしょにケーキバイキングに行かない？

context_sentences.en: The Christmas party will be buffet style.
context_sentences.ja: クリスマスパーティーは、バイキング形式にする予定だよ。

context_sentences.en: The X-rays showed no abnormalities.
context_sentences.ja: レントゲン写真には、異常は認められませんでした。

context_sentences.en: Let's take a chest X-ray just to be sure.
context_sentences.ja: 念の為、胸部のレントゲンを撮りましょう。

context_sentences.en: Please wait in front of the X-ray room.
context_sentences.ja: レントゲン室の前でお待ちください。

context_sentences.en: It's just a fluke.
context_sentences.ja: ただのまぐれだよ。

context_sentences.en: It was just a lucky guess.
context_sentences.ja: まぐれで当たっただけなんだよね。

context_sentences.en: Even if it's a fluke, it's still great!
context_sentences.ja: まぐれでもすごいよ！

context_sentences.en: Ah, we're out of staples.
context_sentences.ja: あ、ホッチキスの針、切れちゃった。

context_sentences.en: Wow, that's thick! I wonder if I can staple it together with this stapler?
context_sentences.ja: うわっ、分厚い！このホッチキスでとじれるかな？

context_sentences.en: When stapling Japanese documents, it is common practice to staple the top right corner for vertical writing and the top left corner for horizontal writing.
context_sentences.ja: 日本の書類をホッチキスで止める時は、縦書きの場合は右上、横書きの場合は左上をホチキスで止めるのが一般的です。
